metadata.text1:
1. Check if breast feeding well
2. Check if mother has been tested for HIV and refer for testing if HIV status unknown
3. Remind mothers to take infants to the local clinic for review at 3 days
4. Ensure baby has passed urine and stool in first 24 hours. 

If baby less than 24 hours old and has not passed urine or stool, ensure mother knows to seek a review locally or at HCH if stool/urine passage delayed beyond 24 hours.
metadata.text2:
JAUNDICE 
Cataracts (red reflex)
Talipes: refer to orthopods/physio
Hip dysplasia
Extra digits
Heart murmurs
Anal atresia
metadata.text3: Do not separate the mother from the infant if not absolutely necessary. Consider if observation may be sufficient without admission.
